subject: Biology
text: Respiration which releases energy from food in living organisms can be summarised by the following equation: glucose + oxygen → carbon dioxide + water. A student investigated the rate at which oxygen was used for respiration by some small animals.

original_question.question_text: Respiration which releases energy from food in living organisms can be summarised by the following equation: glucose + oxygen → carbon dioxide + water. A student investigated the rate at which oxygen was used for respiration by some small animals.

difficulty.justification: Requires understanding of respiration, data analysis, and graph interpretation

sub_questions.text: Describe what happens to the carbon dioxide they produce.
Explain why the drop of coloured liquid moves along the capillary tube towards the small animals.
Complete Table 1.1 by inserting these readings.
Construct a graph of the data in the completed Table 1.1 on the grid below. Join your plotted points with ruled, straight lines.
Use your graph to estimate the position of the drop at 25 minutes.
Calculate the distance moved by the drop during the investigation.
Calculate the rate of movement of the drop during the investigation in cm per minute.
Suggest why the student should repeat this investigation several times.
Suggest a control experiment for this investigation.
